record.description: No reason specified (Key Revocation or Certification Revocation signatures)
Key material has been compromised (Key Revocation signatures)
Key is retired and no longer used (Key Revocation signatures)
User ID information is no longer valid (Certification Revocation signatures)

registry.title: OpenPGP New Packet Versions (OBSOLETE)
registry.note: Those wishing to use the removed "New Packet Versions" registry should instead register new versions of the relevant packets in the "OpenPGP Key and Signature Versions", "OpenPGP Key IDs and Fingerprints", and "OpenPGP Encrypted Message Packet Versions" registries.

registry.title: OpenPGP Key Flags
registry.expert: Daniel Kahn Gillmor, Andrew Gallagher, Heiko Schäfer
registry.note: This is a variable length bit field.

record.description: This key may be used to make User ID certifications (Signature Type IDs 0x10-0x13) or Direct Key signatures (Signature Type ID 0x1F) over other keys.
This key may be used to sign data.
This key may be used to encrypt communications.
This key may be used to encrypt storage.
The private component of this key may have been split by a secret-sharing mechanism.
This key may be used for authentication.
The private component of this key may be in the possession of more than one person.

registry.title: OpenPGP Public Key Algorithms
registry.expert: Daniel Kahn Gillmor, Andrew Gallagher, Heiko Schäfer

record.pkesk: MPI(g^k mod p), MPI(m * y^k mod p) RFC9580, Section 5.1.4

record.public: MPI(p), MPI(q), MPI(g), MPI(y) RFC9580, Section 5.5.5.2
OID, MPI(point in curve-specific point format), KDFParams RFC9580, Sections 9.2.1 and 5.5.5.6
record.secret: MPI(value in curve-specific format) RFC9580, Section 9.2.1
record.pkesk: MPI(point in curve-specific point format), size octet, encoded key RFC9580, Sections 9.2.1, 5.1.5, and 11.5

record.public: OID, MPI(point in SEC1 format) RFC9580, Section 5.5.5.4

record.description: Reserved for Diffie-Hellman (X9.42, as defined for IETF-S/MIME)

record.public: OID, MPI(point in prefixed native format) RFC9580, Sections 11.2.2 and 5.5.5.5
record.secret: MPI(value in curve-specific format) RFC9580, Section 9.2.1

record.pkesk: 32 octets, size octet, encoded key RFC9580, Section 5.1.6
56 octets, size octet, encoded key RFC9580, Section 5.1.7

registry.title: OpenPGP Symmetric Key Algorithms
registry.expert: Daniel Kahn Gillmor, Andrew Gallagher, Heiko Schäfer
registry.note:
When registering a new symmetric cipher with a block size of 64 or 128 bits and a key size that is a multiple of 64 bits, no new considerations are needed.
If the new cipher has a different block size, there needs to be additional documentation describing how to use the cipher in CFB mode.
If the new cipher has an unusual key size, then padding needs to be considered for X25519 and X448 key wrapping, which currently needs no padding.

record.description: TripleDES (or DES-EDE) SP800-67 with 168-bit key derived from 192
Reserved to avoid collision with Secret Key Encryption (see the OpenPGP Secret Key Encryption (S2K Usage Octet) registry and RFC9580, Section 5.5.3)

registry.title: OpenPGP Hash Algorithms
registry.expert: Daniel Kahn Gillmor, Andrew Gallagher, Heiko Schäfer
registry.note: When registering a new hash algorithm, if the algorithm is also to be used with RSA signing schemes, it must also have an entry in the "OpenPGP Hash Algorithm Identifiers for RSA Signatures' use of EMSA-PKCS1-v1_5 Padding" registry.

registry.expert: Daniel Kahn Gillmor, Andrew Gallagher, Heiko Schäfer

registry.title: OpenPGP Secret Key Encryption (S2K Usage Octet)
registry.expert: Daniel Kahn Gillmor, Andrew Gallagher, Heiko Schäfer

record.enc: v3 or v4 keys: [cleartext secrets || check(secrets)] v6 keys: [cleartext secrets]

record.value: Known symmetric cipher algo ID (see RFC9580, Section 9.3)

record.encparam: params-length (v6-only), cipher-algo, AEAD-mode, S2K-specifier-length (v6-only), S2K-specifier, nonce

registry.title: OpenPGP Signature Notation Data Subpacket Notation Flags
registry.expert: Daniel Kahn Gillmor, Andrew Gallagher, Heiko Schäfer

registry.title: OpenPGP Signature Notation Data Subpacket Types
registry.expert: Daniel Kahn Gillmor, Andrew Gallagher, Heiko Schäfer
registry.note:
Notation names are arbitrary Unicode strings encoded in UTF-8. They reside in two namespaces: the IETF namespace and the user namespace.
This registry documents the IETF namespace. The names in this registry MUST NOT contain the "@" character (0x40), since the presence of that character indicates the user namespace.

registry.title: OpenPGP ECC Curve OIDs and Usage
registry.expert: Daniel Kahn Gillmor, Andrew Gallagher, Heiko Schäfer
registry.note: When a new elliptic curve is registered for use with OpenPGP, it should also be added to the "OpenPGP ECC Curve-specific Wire Formats" registry. If it is used for ECDH, also add it to the "OpenPGP ECDH KDF and KEK Parameters" registry.

record.description: An integer encoded in big-endian format as a standard OpenPGP MPI
An octet string of fixed length that may be shorter on the wire due to leading zeros being stripped by the MPI encoding and may need to be zero-padded before use
An octet string of fixed length N, prefixed with octet 0x40 to ensure no leading zero octet
